intro: Platycapnos saxicola, commonly known as the saxicola bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals that are often slightly notched. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
